page.title: 06Macclesfield Canal
page.content: Macclesfield canal was built by Thomas Telford and was opened in 1831.The Peak Forest Canal and the Trent and Mersey canal are joined by it.It used to be used to carry goods for industry but now it is not used for this to our knowledge but is used for cruising in narrow boats and other craft. Fishing competitions are often held on its banks.Some people use the old tow path which has recently been resurfaced to walk or to jog along which is a very popular pastime.You are not allowed to ride horses or bicycles on the tow path.The Macclesfield canal is part of the ring of Cheshire canals and James Brindley served his apprenticeship locally at Gurnett and a plaque notes this on the wall of the house
